data.title: Lance Bass Gives Love to Hometown with Viral Meme
data.meta_description: The news that matters to Mississippi.
data.text:
ELLISVILLE, MISS– Even though Lance Bass said “Bye Bye Bye” to Mississippi some time ago, he’s still showing love to Ellisville as his hometown.

Lance Bass was born in Laurel, grew up in Ellisville, then moved to Clinton where he graduated. Bass started his singing career with the Clinton High School choir before joining NSYNC, the popular boy band from the 90’s that produced hits like “Bye Bye Bye,” “Dirty Pop,” and “I Want You Back.”

Bass went on after the band’s breakup to make a documentary called “Mississippi, I Am,” which discusses the issues that the LGBT community faces within the state.

The meme used for the picture is part of a promotional campaign for the upcoming movie “Straight Outta Compton,” that’s being hosted by Beats by Dr. Dre.

photo from Lance Bass’s Facebook page.
